result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ex 1 thru 10 offered and received. Ex 11 offered. Ex 6a and 6b are DVDs. Court exhibits 1 & 2.
two certified copies of Racine county felony judgments of conviction for defendant.
guilty
by the parties. Pawn America video and contract documenting transaction on 5-8-15 are true and accurate.
State

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mario D. White.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jurors brought in at 8:54, jurors sworn.  Judge reads opening instructions.  Opening statments by ADA Cardona and Atty. White.  State calls witnesses, Cross exam by Atty. White.  Marked exhibit 1-11, offered and received 1-10. State rests.  Atty. White moves for judgment of dismissal.  Court rules State has demonstrated it's burden.  Court denies motion.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Jones.  Mr. Jones does with to testify.  Court accepts this.  Atty. White calls witness, sworn, takes stand.  Direct exam by Atty. White, Cross exam by ADA Cardona.  Defense Rests.   Court reads jury instructuions.  Closing arguments by ADA Cardona, Closing arguments by Atty. White, Rebuttal by ADA Cardona.  Court reads remaining jury instructions.  Alternate juror selected.  Bailiff sworn at 3:11.  Jurors released for deliberations at 3:15.  Court receives question at 4:15, but was not signed.  Requested that question be signed.   Bailiff instructs court we have verdict at 4:20.  Counsel called.  Jurors brought backin at 4:35. Foreperson gives bailiff the verdict.  Court reads verdict.  Count 1 Guilty.  Court polls the jury. 11 agree, 1 dissent.  Jurors are excused except for dissenting juror JE, juror number 202.  Atty. White questions juror.  Court instructs juror to return for deliverations.  Has to continue.  Jurors all brought back in.  Explained that they have to continue, jurors are excused again at 4:46.  Bailiff instructs court we have a verdict at 4:52.  Jurors brought back in at 5:05, verdict given to bailiff, court reads verdict.  Count 1, GUILTY.  Court polls jury, all agree the verdict is true.   Jurors excused at 5:10.  State moves for judgment of verdict.  Atty. White moves to not withstand teh verdict.  Court grants motion for verdict.  Parties agree to move forward with sentencing.  State asking for 8 months jail consecutive to any other sentence.  Atty. White asking for 30 days jail concurrent. Mr. Jones speaks to court.  Court orders 45 days jail starting forthwith, concurrent to any sentence already serving.  Court adjourned at 5:22.
and Peremptory Challenges

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mario D. White.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jurors just brought, jurors all sworn, clerk calls 21 names.  Court starts preliminary instructions.  Court starts Voir Dire.  Voir Dire by ADA Cardona.  Voir Dire by Atty. White.  Strikes start at 11:38.  Non called jurors are excused.  Court reads remaining instructions.  Clerk calls 13 names, non selected jurors excused.  Jurors to return Wednesday, March 16, 2016 at 8:15.  Jurors excsued at 11:55.  No motions to be heard at this time.  State does not oppose jurors asking question during trial.  Atty. White does oppose jurors asking questions during trial. Court will consider this, and answer prior to starting on Wednesday.  Court adjourned.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mario D. White.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Cardona states that he would have a hard time getting this case along with another two day trial done in the same week.  Court states another DA should be able to handle this.  Went over MIL's from the state.  Set for jury selection on Monday.

Attorney Mario D. White in court on behalf of defendant.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Writ did not include the status date, so he is not here.  Should be back on Friday in the jail.  Atty. White to speak with him about cases set for jury selection on Monday the 14th.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
